description.narrative:
This Honey Value Chain aims at Creating Women and Youth livelihood opportunities in apiculture in Uganda. this intervention is forone year and it is supporting the Ongoing work under the Irish Aid funded Bee better Project. The project will be implemented By The Uganda National Apiculture Development Association (TUNADO) in Karamoja (Kotido district) and WestNile (Nebbi and Arua districts)sub regions of Northern Uganda by March 2019.
TUNADO during this project Implementation will ensure that the small holder Bee keepers are trained on Bee hive making, making Harvesting Gears and trainings on honey harvesting, Processing and value addition such making other honey products. this is to ensure that the bee keepers especially women benefit from all stages of the value chain and ensure resource utilization. TUNADO will also ensure that the bee keepers are availed with market information and linked to markets.At the national level a multi-stakeholder workshop will be organized to influence decisions that affect small holder Bee keepers

participating-org.narrative: The Uganda National Apiculture Dev' TUNADO

The Uganda National Apiculture Development Organisation (TUNADO) Vision is #Being a vibrant membership based apex body coordinatingapiculture industry in Uganda for sustainable national development#. Mission #to provide a national platform for stakeholders to promote and develop economically viable and environmentally sustainable apiculture industry in Uganda. Our core values 1) Accountability, 2) Good Governance, 3) Non-discriminatory, 4) Innovativeness and 5) Voluntarism. TUNADO was formed in 2003 andformally registered in 2004 as a company limited by guarantee Reg No. 62239. TUNADO was formed with the major objective of bringing beekeepers and allsector players together, being a voice for the voiceless, promoting beekeeping, facilitating market linkages of bee products locally and internationally, protecting bee resources, building capacity of beekeepers, lobby and advocacy. These are realised in TUNADO#sstrategic plan with four Strategic objectives of 1) Advocacy for favourable policies, 2) Membership servicing, 3) High level apiculture promotion and 4) institution strengthening. In 2000, Beekeepers demanded Government to support them in establishing a national body that will offer sector coordination. In 2001 the Government of Uganda and Commonwealth Secretariat commissioned a study to establish the strategy for developing apiculture sector to contribute to national economic development. Recommendation number 6.5 stipulated a need for establishment of a private led national beekeepers# coordinating body. In October 2002, the Government through Office of the Prime Minister responded to the recommendation and beekeepers# demand and held several stakeholders# consultative meetings that gave birth to TUNADO in 2003. TUNADO was hence formed with mandate to coordinate the apiculture sector in Uganda. It is a national body and member based organisation uniting beekeepers, processors, packers, service providers # trainers # researchers # marketers - equipment manufacturers, Development Partners, Government and other stakeholders towards apiculture development in Uganda. To-date, TUNADO represents 1,200,000 beekeepers in Uganda (UBOS 2010), it has direct membership of 89000 beekeepers organised in 282 cooperatives, groups and companies. TUNADO is well recognised by Government of Uganda through MAAIF with a working MoU as a national body responsible for coordination apiculture industry in Uganda. TUNADO has grown to be widely recognised and respected as the 'go-to'body for beekeeping in Uganda and a reference point for other African nations and beyond.
